title: Aurex Paper Trading App (virtual investing simulator)

requirements.text: Create the Aurex paper trading app as a virtual investing/trading simulator (paper trading only) where users can simulate investing with virtual money and no real broker integration.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can sign in and use the app without any real-money or broker API connectivity.
All user-facing copy is in English and clearly states this is paper trading / simulated trading.
Core simulator features (cash balance, placing trades, portfolio updates, history) are available end-to-end.

requirements.text: Implement authentication and per-user data isolation using Internet Identity, so each user has their own virtual cash balance, holdings, and trade history.
acceptanceCriteria: User data (cash/holdings/history) is keyed by authenticated principal and is not visible to other users.
Unauthenticated users are prompted to sign in before accessing trading actions.
Sign in/out updates the UI state appropriately.

requirements.text: Backend: Add persistent paper-trading state and APIs in the single Motoko main actor to support: user profile (virtual cash), holdings/positions per symbol, trade/order history, and a simple price board (symbol -> latest price) used for fills and portfolio valuation.
acceptanceCriteria: A new user receives a default starting virtual cash balance (configurable constant).
Holdings update correctly after buy/sell actions; cash decreases on buys and increases on sells.
Trade history entries are stored persistently and returned in reverse-chronological order.
A price board exists and is used consistently to compute order fill price and current portfolio value.
All state lives in the single actor (no additional services/canisters).

requirements.text: Backend: Implement paper order placement endpoints for BUY and SELL market orders for a chosen symbol and quantity, validating inputs and enforcing constraints (e.g., sufficient cash for buys, sufficient holdings for sells).

quotes: Yes and log usme invest kar sake

acceptanceCriteria: BUY fails with a clear error when user cash is insufficient.
SELL fails with a clear error when user position quantity is insufficient.
Quantity must be a positive integer; symbol must be non-empty.
On success, the response returns updated cash and updated position for the symbol.

requirements.text: Frontend: Build the main Aurex UI with pages/sections for Dashboard (account summary), Trade (place buy/sell), Portfolio (positions + P/L using latest prices), and History (executed paper trades).
acceptanceCriteria: Users can navigate between Dashboard, Trade, Portfolio, and History without page reloads.
Trade page allows selecting/typing a symbol, entering quantity, and choosing BUY/SELL.
After placing an order, UI refreshes cash, holdings, and history using React Query invalidation/refetch.
Portfolio shows each symbol position quantity, average cost (if tracked), current price, and unrealized P/L (if applicable).

requirements.text: Frontend + Backend: Provide a simple way to manage symbol prices for the simulator (price board). If no external market data is used, allow setting/updating latest price per symbol from the app UI (restricted to the signed-in user unless an explicit admin concept is implemented).
acceptanceCriteria: Users can set/update the latest price for a symbol used for fills/valuation.
Placing an order uses the latest stored price for that symbol; if missing, the UI shows a clear prompt to set a price first (or backend returns a clear error).
Dashboard/Portfolio valuation uses the same stored prices.

requirements.text: Add an About/Branding section for the app name "Aurex" and include the provided CEO name "Harsh Gupta" as plain, user-provided branding text (no claims of verification).

quotes: Trading app name aurex ceo harsh gupta

acceptanceCriteria: The app displays the name "Aurex" prominently (e.g., header/sidebar).
An About section includes text like "CEO: Harsh Gupta" without stating or implying external verification.

requirements.text: Define and apply a coherent visual theme for Aurex across the UI (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) with a distinct style suitable for a trading simulator; avoid blue/purple as the primary palette.
acceptanceCriteria: A consistent color system and typography is used across all pages (navigation, cards, tables, forms).
The primary palette is not blue/purple.
The UI looks intentionally designed (not default component styling).

constraints: Do not implement real-money investing, broker integrations (Angel One/Zerodha/Upstox), or any live trading connectivity.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo (no additional backend services).
Do not modify files under frontend/immutablePaths (compose them instead).
Use English for all user-facing text.
nonGoals: Real-time market data feeds, WebSockets, or streaming quotes.
External databases or third-party auth providers beyond Internet Identity.
Payments, deposits/withdrawals, KYC/AML flows, or any real investment acceptance.

required: Aurex app logo mark, minimalist geometric bull/bear or candlestick motif, dark-friendly (aurex-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Subtle abstract trading background pattern, low-contrast, dark theme (aurex-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)
